critique: This executive order pertains to the line of succession within the Department of the Treasury. It dictates who can act as Secretary of the Treasury in cases of absence, disability, or vacancy. It revokes a previous executive order on the same topic. There's no indication of ideological bias, immigration stance, or impact on civil liberties. It doesn't expand executive power significantly, as it simply clarifies succession. It doesn't directly affect federalism, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, most scores should be neutral.
